Pertahankan Tradisi dan Budaya Daerah, Disdikbud Kubar beri Bantuan Alat Musik Tradisioal keSekolah
01 Nov 2019, 16:20 by Mikael Carolus Jaang


Pertahankan Tradisi dan Budaya Daerah, Disdikbud Kubar beri Bantuan Alat Musik Tradisioal keSekolah

KBRN, Sendawar: Dinas Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan (Disdikbud) Kabupaten Kutai Barat (Kubar) melalui bidang Pembinaan Pendidikan Dasar (PPD) membagikan alat musik Tradisional kepada 3 Sekolah Dasar (SD), yakni SD Negeri 001 Melak Iliri, Kecamatan Melak. Kemudian SD Negeri 003 Tanjung Jone, Kecamatan Jempang. Dan SD Negeri 005 Muara Kelawit, Kecamatan Siluq Ngurai.
Kepala Bidang PPD Dinas Pendidikan dan Kebudayaan Kubar Y. Yamon kepada RRI Sendawar, Jumat (1/11/2019) mengatakan, pemberian alat musik tradisional ini dilakukan sebagai bentuk dukungan dalam mengenalkan pendidikan kebudayaan bagi Generasi Muda Kubar sejak ini. Sehingga kedepannya bisa dikembangkan dan terus dilestarikan agar tidak punah akibat perkembangan jaman.
Alat musik yang diberikan ini, lanjut Yamon menyesuaikan etnis suku dayak yang mendiami Kabupaten Kutai Barat, diantaranya Sampeq, Geluning (Gening), Gendang, Rabana, Biola, dan Giring-Giring.
“Seperti Sapeq inikan etnis Bahau, Oheng dan Kenyah. Kemudian Gening terus Gendang itu dari etnis Tunjung dan Benuaq. Kemudian seperti Rabana, Giring-giring dan Biola itu dari etnis Melayu. Ini kita berikan sesuai kebutuhan anak-anak di Sekolah, kalau memang mereka etnisnya Bahau, Oheng dan Kenyah mereka bisa belajar Sapeq, begitu juga dengan yang etnis Tunjung dan Benuaq serta etnis Melayu,”lanjutnya
Yamon menegaskan, untuk tahun 2019 ini, pihaknya hanya memberikan bantuan alat musik tradisional kepada 3 sekolah. Namun kedepannya akan diberikan secara bertahap kepada tiap sekolah yang tersebar di Kabupaten Kutai Barat hingga tingkat Sekolah Menegah Atas (SMA).
Maka itu, Ia berharap melalui bantuan yang diberikan ini, pihak sekolah dapat mengenalkan alat-alat musik tradisional daerah kepada Siswa-Siswi yang dimiliki, agar tidak tidak melupakan akar dan budaya Daerah, ditengah pesatnya perkembangan digitalisasi saat ini.

Preserve Regional Traditions and Culture, Kubik Disdikbud gives assistance of Tradition Musical Instruments to School
Nov 01 2019, 16:20 by Mikael Carolus Jaang


Preserve Regional Traditions and Culture, Kubik Disdikbud gives assistance of Tradition Musical Instruments to School

KBRN, Sendawar: Education and Culture Office (Disdikbud) of the West Kutai Regency (Kubar) through the Basic Education Development (PPD) division distributing traditional musical instruments to 3 elementary schools, namely SD Negeri 001 Melak Iliri, Melak District. Then 003 Tanjung Jone Public Elementary School, Jempang District. And State Elementary School 005 Muara Kelawit, Siluq Ngurai District.
Head of PPD Department of Education and Culture Kubar Y. Yamon to RRI Sendawar, Friday (11/01/2019) said, the provision of traditional musical instruments was done as a form of support in introducing cultural education for the Kubar Young Generation. So that in the future it can be developed and continue to be preserved so it will not become extinct due to the development of the era.
This instrument, Yamon continued, adjusted the ethnic Dayaks who inhabit West Kutai Regency, including Sampeq, Geluning, Gendang, Rabana, Violin, and Giring-Giring.
"Like Sapeq, it is an ethnic Bahau, Oheng and Kenyah ethnic group. Then Gening continued to drum from ethnic Tunjung and Benuaq. Then like Rabana, the Giring-sleigh and Violin are ethnic Malays. We give this according to the needs of the children in the School, if indeed they are ethnic Bahau, Oheng and Kenyah they can learn Sapeq, as well as those from Tunjung and Benuaq ethnic groups as well as ethnic Malays, "he continued
Yamon asserted, for 2019, his party only provided traditional musical instruments to 3 schools. But in the future it will be given in stages to each school in West Kutai Regency up to the level of the Senior High School (SMA).
Therefore, he hopes that through this assistance, the school can introduce traditional traditional musical instruments to the students, so as not to forget the roots and culture of the region, amid the rapid development of digitalization at this time.
